alert.note: Alert for Ballard; Carlisle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:52AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Union, southwestern Pulaski, Alexander, western Carlisle, Ballard, Mississippi, Scott, northeastern New Madrid and northeastern Stoddard Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 651 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cape Girardeau to near Dutchtown to near Advance. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Scott City, Kelso and Cape Girardeau Airport around 655 AM CDT. Oran and Benton around 700 AM CDT. Morley, Tamms, Hay-Wood City and Olive Branch around 705 AM CDT. Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area around 710 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Miner, Mounds, Mound City, Charleston, Cairo, Bertrand, Wyatt, East Prairie, La Center, Wickliffe, Barlow, Anniston and Bardwell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 15. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 1 and 21. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 50 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
